data.title: List of PSP games with PS5 trophy support to play in August 2024
data.meta_description: Our comprehensive PSP games on PS5 list lets you know exactly which classic portable games are available on PS5, PS4, and PS Plus with trophies.
data.text:
Our comprehensive PSP games on PS5 list lets you know exactly which classic portable games are available on PS5, PS4, and PS Plus with trophies.

Lee Brady

Published 05 Aug 2024

Followtopics

PlayStation PlusTrophy ListLee Brady

PS Plus Premium subscribers now have a veritable treasure trove of classic trophies to collect thanks to the service's ever-growing PSP games on PS5 list. Below, we've listed all of the PSP games on PS5 and PS4 with trophy lists, the vast majority of which have platinum trophies to help incentivize you.

Every PSP game with trophies available on PS5 and PS4

Emulated PSP games started showing up on PS5, PS4, and PS Plus Premium in 2022, and since then we've received a steady trickle of new ports every month or so. While not every PSP game on PS5 and PS4 has a platinum trophy, the vast majority do, so there's a good chance you'll have trophy to hunt in your favorite PSP classic.

Check out the full list of PSP games on PS5 and PS4 below!

Ape Academy 2

Here are the Ape Academy 2 trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: March 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

Much like the first game in this series, this Ape Escape minigame compilation spin-off is a fun time-waster, though not exactly something you should be going out of your way to revisit on PS5 and PS4. It does come with a remarkably easy platinum trophy to collect, so that's something, but perhaps check out the original Ape Escape instead?

Ape Escape Academy

Here are the Ape Escape Academy trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: October 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

This PSP minigame compilation certainly possess the wacky charm of the Ape Escape series, but its hardly what I'd call a must-play game on PS5 and PS4. The platinum trophy here is pretty easy, so if you're a PSP trophy hunter, this could help kill a few hours. Otherwise, either check out the slightly more feature-rich sequel or just play a full Ape Escape game on PS Plus Premium.

Ape Escape On The Loose

Here are the Ape Escape On The Loose trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: August 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

I'll be honest with you — before I played Ape Escape On The Loose, I thought the concept of it sounded dreadful. A remake of the first Ape Escape game minus all the analog stick gimmicks that make the original game so iconic? It sounds bad on paper, but upon playing this one, I found it just as fun as the PS1 classic. Those original Ape Escape levels are just a good time! Plus, you can nab this platinum in just a few hours.

Blade Dancer Lineage of Light

Here are the Blade Dancer Lineage of Light trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: May 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 4/10

By today's standards, Blade Dancer is a pretty sluggish RPG to revisit on PS5 and PS4, which makes it a hard recommend for anyone looking for a retro JRPG to sink their teeth into. However, the plot does have its moments and the visuals are pretty good for the PSP, so it's worth checking out if you're a massive genre aficionado. Keep in mind that this platinum trophy will prove to be a little more taxing than other games on this list simply by being a massive time sink.

Coded Soul

Here are the Coded Soul trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: June 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

I would love to tell you a little more about this PSP JRPG, but unfortunately the PS Plus version of Coded Soul is only available to Japanese subscribers. Looking over the trophy list here, it all seems pretty straightforward, but that's hardly going to help us poor Westerners who can't access the game on PS5 or PS4.

Daxter

Here are the Daxter trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: June 2024

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

This solo spin-off for the little "ottsel" with the big mouth is an absolute blast from the past and a sizeable platforming adventure all on its own terms. To unlock Daxter's PSP platinum trophy, you'll need to explore every inch of the game and take part in every side adventure and minigame. Still, it's a delightfully well realized Jak and Daxter spin-off, so absolutely check it out on PS5 and PS4!

Echochrome

Here are the Echochrome trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: June 2022

Trophy list difficulty: 4/10

This PlayStation puzzler still feels charming and unique by today's standards, so if you're on the hunt for a PSP game with some meat on its bones, this would be my recommendation. In Echochrome, you're tasked with solving perspective puzzles that draw upon the works of MC Escher. Some of these can get pretty tricky too, so you might need a guide handy if you're going to gun for the game's platinum trophy.

Echoshift

Here are the Echoshift trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: July 2022

Trophy list difficulty: 4/10

This sequel to Echochrome takes the same perspective puzzle idea and twists it with a whole new set of gimmicks and additions to further break your brain. It can get pretty hard at times, so if you want to make the hunt for Echoshift's game's platinum trophy, just make sure to have a guide handy.

Gravity Crash Portable

Here are the Gravity Crash Portable trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: July 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 4/10

This fast-shooting action arcade hit still feels just as good to play today, so if you're looking for a PSP game to get addicted to on PS5 and PS4, this is the one to go for. Those trophies will require a little bit of skill to unlock as well, although remember that you have a rewind button at your disposal.

Jak and Daxter The Lost Frontier

Here are the Jak and Daxter The Lost Frontier trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: March 2024

Trophy list difficulty: 4/10

This divisive entry in the Jak and Daxter franchise might not have Naughty Dog's seal of approval, but it's still fun to see these characters again after such a long time. The platinum trophy here won't be the easiest — tricky flying missions make it a pain to collect everything. Still, if you're a fan of the series, this PSP spin-off is a must.

Jeanne d'Arc

Here are the Jeanne d'Arc trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: July 2024

Trophy list difficulty: 5/10

There are a bunch of reasons why you should check out the excellent PS Plus Premium release of Jeanne d'Arc — after all, it is a massively overlooked gem in the PSP games catalog. That said, one key reason is also to pick up that fairly reasonable platinum trophy, which mercifully won't waste your time too much.

Sure, you'll have to get invested in all the bonus stages to collect all these PSP trophies, but this tactical RPG is so good you'll probably be doing that anyway!

Killzone Liberation

Here are the Killzone Liberation trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: June 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

The oft-overlooked first portable spin-off in the Killzone series might not have the budget or the first-person camera controls seen in the later portable Killzone Mercenary, but it's still a good time. In Liberation, you play as the protagonist of the first game on a new mission, all of which is present from an overhead camera angle. It's a fun portable shooter, if a little dated, and its platinum trophy should unlock pretty easily for you.

Kingdom of Paradise

Here are the Kingdom of Paradise trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: September 2022

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

Also known as Key of Heaven, this PSP action RPG actually does have some pretty fun gameplay if you don't mind a bit of repetition in your combat! The trophy list isn't too tricky either — just invest yourself in doing everything and you'll have that platinum trophy in no time. It's a great one for switching your brain off and just have a chill time collecting trophies on PS5 and PS4.

LocoRoco Midnight Carnival

Here are the LocoRoco Midnight Carnival trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: July 2022

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

All of the LocoRoco games are an absolute delight, and LocoRoco Midnight Carnival is no exception. While it might not have the clean and crisp graphics of the PS4 LocoRoco remasters, it's still a fun experience for fans of the series. The platinum trophy won't prove too challenging either, although you might need to replay a few levels just to get all your little crazy blobs in order.

MediEvil Resurrection

Here are the MediEvil Resurrection trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: August 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

If you're looking to play MediEvil on PS Plus, you could do a little worse than the PSP version of the game. While it can be a little troublesome with its lack of a right analog stick, the game still feels very much like the MediEvil we all know and love. Plus, it's a pretty simple one to platinum — don't forget you can revisit levels when you have all those power-ups unlocked!

No Heroes Allowed

Here are the No Heroes Allowed trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: July 2022

Trophy list difficulty: 4/10

No Heroes Allowed is a pretty tricky strategy/base defense game which, I have to say, plays a lot better than a lot of these PSP ports on PS5 and PS4. You'll find the trophies here a little harder to earn than most games on the list too, although it's also probably one of the more rewarding games to pick up and play.

Pinball Heroes

Here are the Pinball Heroes trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: December 2022

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

Step back in time to the PS3 era of PlayStation, where franchises like MotorStorm and Uncharted ruled the roost. In Pinball Heroes, you can experience some fun little pinball tables themed after big PlayStation IP. It's perhaps one of the easiest platinum trophies Sony has ever released, which makes it an easy recommendation to those looking to round out their collection of PSP platinum trophies.

Pursuit Force

Here are the Pursuit Force trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: May 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

One of the most underrated action games on the PSP, Pursuit Force can be a really enjoyable time so long as you don't feel like comparing it to any modern titles. The game is a pretty simple shooter with some really fun vehicle sections where you leap from car to car arresting and shooting fools. It's also a pretty simple platinum trophy to earn, so why not revisit this one?

Pursuit Force Extreme Justice

Here are the Pursuit Force Extreme Justice trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: August 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

Just like the first game in the series, Pursuit Force Extreme Justice offers some excellent and underrated PSP action to play on your PS5 and PS4. This time around, the setpieces are even crazier — there's a whole hoverboat chase scene! It's a great time and it's an easy platinum trophy to unlock, so check this one out.

Ratchet and Clank Size Matters

Here are the Ratchet and Clank Size Matters trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: July 2024

Trophy list difficulty: 3/10

While this might not be the best Ratchet and Clank outing in the franchise's long history, it's still a perfectly enjoyable romp with your favorite lombax and defective killbot. Plus, there really is no better past time on PS5 or PS4 than collecting Ratchet and Clank platinum trophies, so we're thrilled to see this PSP port get trophy support.

If you're only used to playing the most recent Ratchet and Clank games, then you might be surprised by how involving this trophy list is. It's still a relative breeze for ardent trophy hunters, but you'll need to unlock all the in-game skill points to access the High Impact Treehouse. That's a feat that will require some effort — or a walkthrough. Besides that, though, this platinum is a piece of cake.

Resistance Retribution

Here are the Resistance Retribution trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: February 2024

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

While it lacks the precision and care of its mainline console cousins, Resistance Retribution is still a worthwhile experience if you're a big fan of this dormant PlayStation IP. The platinum trophy here is an absolute breeze to earn, plus its just fun to shoot Chimera no matter how compressed the graphics are.

Super Stardust Portable

Here are the Super Stardust Portable trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: June 2022

Trophy list difficulty: 4/10

This arcade shooter from the immeasurably talented folks at Housemarque still feels just as great to play today as it did when it released. That's not something that can be said about even half of the PSP games on this list! The platinum trophy for this one can be a little bit trickier, but remember you have a Rewind button if you need a little help.

Syphon Filter Dark Mirror

Here are the Syphon Filter Dark Mirror trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: March 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

Gabe returns to duty in this PSP follow-up to the beloved PS1 action franchise. While a little bit darker and also a bit less memorable than the last PS1 Syphon Filter game, Dark Mirror still has a lot to offer for fans of PSP games. Plus, it's another simply platinum from the series. All you have to do is beat the campaign and this PSP platinum is yours!

Syphon Filter Logan's Shadow

Here are the Syphon Filter Logan's Shadow trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: May 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

The very last of Gabe's adventures (for now), Syphon Filter Logan's Shadow continues the solid work started by Dark Mirror on PSP. It's a fun action game and it has all the mature violence that was weirdly removed from the game's PS2 version! The platinum trophy here is also pretty easy — just beat the game and this will unlock for you.

Thrillville

Here are the Thrillville trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: December 2023

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

At first glance, we thought the trophies for Thrillville looked a little intimidating. However, as it turns out, this theme park sim is a breeze to platinum! Since you don't have to complete any missions or even deal with the final park, you can directly target every challenge on the trophy list without worrying about playing the game 'correctly.' That makes Thrillville one of the easiest PSP platinums available.

Toy Story 3

Here are the Disney Pixar Toy Story 3 trophies

PS5 and PS4 release date: June 2024

Trophy list difficulty: 2/10

While not as enjoyable as the PS1 take on Toy Story 2, the PSP game Toy Story 3 is still a pretty enjoyable time for fans of these old movie tie-ins. You're still playing as Buzz, wandering around large environments looking for things to collect. The platinum trophy will be the real draw here — you can take unlock this one after just a few hours of gameplay.

PSP games on PS5 lacking trophy support

While the Toy Story 3 PSP platinum trophy revealed that third-party PS1 trophy support could be a possibility, there are a few PSP games on PS5 and PS4 that have yet to receive any trophies. All of the games listed below can be played on PS5 and PS4, but don't expect to earn any platinum trophies for doing so.

Check out the list of PSP games without trophy support below.

Disney Pixar Up

Gods Eater Burst

Lego Star Wars 2 The Original Trilogy

Ridge Racer 2

SoulCalibur Broken Destiny

Tekken 6

Thrillville Off the Rails

Between these PSP games and the full PS1 games list of titles that feature trophy support, you have plenty of options on PS Plus Premium for some classic trophy hunting! Let us know in the comments if you plan to earn any of these PSP platinum trophies above!

Written by Lee Brady

Staff Writer Lee keeps one eye on the future (Astro Bot), one eye on the past (PS1, PS2, and PS3 games), and his secret third eye on junk he really likes (Final Fantasy, Kingdom Hearts, Sonic). A PlayStation fan for over 25 years, he loves replaying classic games via PS Plus.
